comedy_plus: Comedians, improv shows and open mics.
simple_plus: One click, secure payment, instant confirmation — done.
trusted_plus: Official seats only. No resellers, no stress.

partner_intro_lead: Together we make live experiences visible – for organisers, venues and agencies.
partner_why_p1: OnTicket is Austria’s fresh ticketing platform with a focus on fairness, technology and service. We work with organisers, venues and agencies to make events visible and handle ticket sales transparently and efficiently.
partner_why_p2: With us, you reach a digital audience as well as loyal fans. We rely on clear communication, official allocations, real-time data and an interface that convinces both users and partners.
partner_who_organizers_d: Concerts, shows, comedy, sports – support with marketing, ticketing & reporting.
partner_who_venues_d: From club to arena: seating plans, allocations, access management & integrations.
partner_who_agencies_d: Joint campaigns, flexible tools & co-branding options.
partner_who_shops_d: Sell tickets on site – with simple settlement & support.
partner_benefit_reach_d: OnTicket brings your events to a broad, digitally savvy audience.
partner_benefit_transparency_d: Real-time data on sales, capacity and revenue.
partner_benefit_tech_d: Modern API, fast backend, intuitive interfaces.
partner_benefit_flex_d: Different ticket types, pricing models & discount logic.
partner_benefit_service_d: Support for you and your audience – online & by phone.
partner_how_contact_d: You get in touch with us – we discuss goals & requirements.
partner_how_setup_d: We create seating plans, allocations and ticket types together.
partner_how_sales_d: Events go live – with real-time reporting.
partner_how_support_d: We support you and your visitors all the way to the event.
partner_cta_lead: Interested? Write to us – we look forward to your message.
careers_lead: Help us make live experiences easier, fairer and more accessible.
no_open_positions_body: At the moment we don’t have any open roles. If you’re still interested in working with us or have questions, we’re happy to hear from you.
legal_lead_ecg: Legal information pursuant to § 5 ECG / § 14 UGB
choose_ticket_delivery: Choose how you want to receive your tickets
enter_buyer_details_hint: Enter the buyer details. All fields are required except phone.
must_accept_terms_privacy_to_order: You must accept the terms & conditions and the privacy policy to place an order.
send_updates_optional: I’d like to receive updates & offers (optional)
enter_attendee_full_name_hint: Enter the full name of the attending person for each ticket that requires personalisation.
sign_in_description: Sign in if you already have an account
sign_up_description: Create an account if you don’t have one yet
my_tickets_description: Tickets are sorted by event date – upcoming events appear first.
user_home_blurb: Your home for concerts, theatre, sports and festivals. Manage your tickets, discover new shows and never miss an event again.
account_home_blurb: Your home for concerts, theatre, sports and festivals. Manage your tickets, discover new shows and never miss an event again.
view_transfer_download_tickets: View, transfer and download your tickets.
manage_profile_keep_safe: Manage your profile and keep your account safe.
discover_concerts_theater_festivals: Discover concerts, theatre and festivals near you.
save_favorite_artists_venues: Save your favourite artists and venues for quick access.
create_event_description: Fill in the form below to create and customise your upcoming event
review_zone_summary: Review the summary per zone. Export PDFs and/or save the generated tickets to the database.
check_pdf_before_saving: Please carefully check the generated PDF before saving the tickets.

Hello,

Your email address was just changed to {newEmail}! If you did not request this, please contact support immediately.
agb_item_1_a: These General Terms and Conditions (GTC) apply to all contracts between OnTicket GmbH (hereinafter "OnTicket") and its customers for the purchase of tickets for events of all kinds offered via OnTicket’s online shop. OnTicket is not the organiser of the events offered, but acts solely as an intermediary or seller of tickets on behalf of the respective organiser. The contracting party with regard to the execution of the event is exclusively the respective organiser. Additional terms and conditions of the organiser may apply to this contractual relationship.
agb_item_2_a: By clicking the 'Buy now' button, the customer submits a binding offer to conclude a purchase contract for the selected tickets. A contract is only concluded when OnTicket sends the customer an order confirmation and a transaction number by email. In the case of advance payment, the contract is deemed concluded only upon receipt of full payment. OnTicket endeavours to provide correct information at all times. No guarantee is given for technical transmission errors or incorrect information transmitted to us by the organiser, unless OnTicket has acted with gross negligence.
agb_item_3_a: All prices include statutory VAT. Additional service and shipping fees may apply depending on the offer; these are shown separately during the order process. The final price may differ from the price printed on the ticket. Payment can be made using the payment methods offered in the webshop (e.g. credit card, instant transfer, online banking, prepayment). Tickets are only valid after full payment has been received.
agb_item_4_a: Pursuant to § 18 para. 1 no. 10 FAGG, there is no right of withdrawal for the purchase of tickets for leisure events, as the service is provided at a specific time or within a specific period. Every ticket order is therefore binding and obliges the customer to accept and pay.
agb_item_5_a: Delivery is carried out electronically (e-ticket/mobile ticket) and by email. Tickets must be kept carefully; misuse, copying or altering is prohibited. At admission, the principle of first entry applies: the first successfully scanned ticket entitles the holder to enter, identical subsequent tickets are automatically invalid. By using the ticket, the customer also accepts the organiser’s terms and conditions and the house rules of the venue.
agb_item_6_a: OnTicket may cancel orders (even after a transaction number has been assigned) if conditions set by the organiser or OnTicket are violated or an attempt is made to circumvent them (e.g. exceeding the maximum number of tickets per customer, unauthorised commercial resale, use of multiple accounts/bots, breach of ticket conditions). A cancellation may be implied by refunding the amount paid.
agb_item_7_a: In the event of cancellation, postponement or significant changes, the organiser alone is responsible. OnTicket is not liable for the refund of ticket prices; however, OnTicket assists with processing if the organiser commissions OnTicket to do so and provides the necessary funds. Service and shipping fees already provided are not refunded. Reasonable changes to the programme, line-up or schedule do not entitle the customer to return tickets.
agb_item_8_a: The customer is only entitled to set-off if their counterclaims have been legally established, are undisputed or recognised by OnTicket, or are legally related to the customer’s obligation.
agb_item_9_a: If OnTicket offers purchase on account, the invoice amount is due on the calendar day stated on the invoice. This option is not available for all offers and may be subject to a successful credit check. In the case of an assignment of claims, payment with debt-discharging effect can only be made to the payment service provider specified.
agb_item_10_a: OnTicket may temporarily block user accounts or restrict functions if there are concrete indications of misuse, violations of these GTC, incorrect information or security risks. The customer is obliged to keep access data confidential and to inform OnTicket immediately if misuse is suspected.
agb_item_11_a: OnTicket acts solely as the ticket seller and is not the organiser. OnTicket assumes no responsibility for the execution, safety, organisation, content or course of the event. This also includes all incidents at the venue, including injuries, property damage or other damage that may arise in connection with the event. All claims relating to the event itself must be addressed directly to the organiser. OnTicket is liable exclusively for its own services and only to the extent required by mandatory law.
agb_item_12_a: If OnTicket offers vouchers, these can only be redeemed within the indicated periods and in accordance with the respective voucher conditions.
agb_item_13_a: Information on the processing of personal data (in particular for ticket purchase, customer accounts, payment processing and communication) can be found in OnTicket’s privacy policy. This policy forms an integral part of these GTC.
agb_item_14_a: OnTicket GmbH, Wipplingerstraße 32/19b, 1010 Vienna, Austria. Contact: office@onticket.at.
agb_item_15_a: Austrian law applies, excluding conflict-of-law rules and the UN Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods. The place of jurisdiction – as far as legally permissible – is Vienna. Should individual provisions of these GTC be wholly or partially invalid, the validity of the remaining provisions shall not be affected.
dp_item_1_a:
The controller responsible for processing your personal data within the meaning of the GDPR is:
OnTicket GmbH
Wipplingerstraße 32/19b, 1010 Vienna, Austria
Tel: +43 676 5173799 | Email: office@onticket.at
Managing director: Gabriel Skraba
Company register court: Commercial Court of Vienna
dp_item_2_a:
We process different categories of personal data:
- Private customers: name, address, email, phone number, date of birth (optional), payment data, order history
- Business customers & contractual partners: company, contact person, contact details, contract and billing information
- Organisers: names and contact details of contact persons, bank details
- Newsletter subscribers: email address, where applicable interests
- Website visitors: IP address, browser information, log files, cookies, device information
- Applicants: master data, contact data, CV and application documents
dp_item_3_a:
Data is processed for the following purposes:
- Handling ticket purchases, creating and managing customer accounts
- Fulfilling legal obligations (e.g. tax retention periods)
- Customer communication (support, queries, information about orders)
- Shipping and provision of tickets
- Marketing and informational measures (e.g. newsletter, where consent has been given)
- IT security, fraud prevention and misuse prevention
- Application management and staff selection
dp_item_4_a:
Processing is based on the following legal grounds:
- Performance and initiation of contracts (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR)
- Fulfilment of legal obligations (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. c GDPR)
- Legitimate interests (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR), e.g. for IT security, fraud prevention or direct marketing
- Consent (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR), e.g. for newsletters
dp_item_5_a:
To perform our services, we disclose data to the following categories of recipients:
- Organisers of booked events (for access control, guest list management and on-site contract execution)
- Payment service providers and banks (for payment processing)
- Shipping and logistics companies (if postal delivery is selected)
- IT and hosting providers (as processors)
- Tax advisers, auditors, lawyers
- Authorities and courts within the framework of legal obligations
No further transfer takes place without your explicit consent.
dp_item_6_a: Processing outside the EU/EEA generally does not take place. Should this exceptionally be necessary (e.g. use of external IT service providers based in third countries), this will only occur on the basis of your explicit consent or in compliance with appropriate safeguards pursuant to Art. 44 et seq. GDPR (e.g. EU standard contractual clauses).
dp_item_7_a:
Personal data is stored only as long as necessary for the respective purposes:
- Contract and invoice data: 7 years (pursuant to § 132 BAO / UGB)
- Application documents: 6 months after completion of the recruitment process (pursuant to GlBG)
- Newsletter data: until you withdraw your consent
- Server log files: up to 14 days (for security analysis), then deleted or anonymised
- Other data: as long as statutory retention obligations exist or limitation periods for potential legal claims have not expired.
dp_item_8_a: If you contact us by phone, email or contact form, we store the information you provide (e.g. name, email address, phone number, subject) in order to process your enquiry and in case of follow-up questions. This data will not be passed on without your consent.
dp_item_9_a: If you apply to OnTicket, we process your personal data exclusively to handle your application and to decide on the establishment of an employment relationship. In the event of rejection, we delete your data 6 months after completion of the selection process (to defend potential claims under the Equal Treatment Act). With your separate consent, we may keep your data on record for longer.
dp_item_10_a: You can subscribe to our newsletter. We use the double opt-in process for this (confirmation email with link). We process your email address and, where applicable, information on your interests. You can unsubscribe at any time via the unsubscribe link in each newsletter or by emailing us.
dp_item_11_a: If you take part in competitions or special promotions, we process the data you provide (e.g. name, address, email) solely for carrying out and handling the promotion. After completion, we delete the data, provided there are no statutory retention obligations.
dp_item_12_a: When you visit our website, certain data is automatically collected for technical reasons (e.g. IP address, date/time of access, browser type, operating system, referrer URL). We use only technically necessary cookies, such as session cookies that are strictly required for operating our shopping cart, login area and correct website function (pursuant to § 165 para. 3 TKG 2021). These cookies do not store personal data for analysis purposes and are usually deleted automatically after the session or when the browser is closed. We currently do not use any analytics, statistics, marketing or tracking cookies from third parties.
dp_item_13_a: With regard to your data stored with us, you generally have the rights of access (Art. 15 GDPR), rectification (Art. 16 GDPR), erasure (Art. 17 GDPR), restriction of processing (Art. 18 GDPR), data portability (Art. 20 GDPR), withdrawal of consent (Art. 7 para. 3 GDPR) and objection (Art. 21 GDPR). If you believe that the processing of your data violates data protection law, you can contact us (office@onticket.at) or lodge a complaint with the data protection authority: Austrian Data Protection Authority, Barichgasse 40–42, 1030 Vienna, dsb@dsb.gv.at.
dp_item_14_a: We take extensive technical and organisational measures (TOMs) to protect your personal data from loss, misuse or unauthorised access, including SSL encryption (https), access restrictions and regular security updates to our IT infrastructure.
dp_item_15_a: We reserve the right to change this privacy policy at any time to comply with current legal requirements or to reflect changes to our services. The current version published on our website is binding.
about_hero_subtitle: Austria’s fresh platform for concerts, shows & sport – fast, fair, secure.
about_onticket_p1: OnTicket is a ticketing company founded in Austria. We are building a modern platform that connects people with live experiences – from pop to theatre, from comedy to sport.
about_onticket_p2: Our mission: make events visible and tickets accessible, reliable and pleasant to book. We combine technology with service so that buying is easy and the anticipation starts early.
about_onticket_p3: We work closely with organisers, venues and agencies, focusing on long-term partnerships, clear processes and respectful collaboration. This creates an ecosystem that supports fans, artists and organisers alike.
about_onticket_p4: As a team we are curious, fast and detail-oriented – with a focus on quality, accessibility and a clean, fair ticket purchase. That’s OnTicket.
about_feature_official_desc: We bundle official allocations directly from organisers and venues. This avoids duplicate listings, ensures valid tickets and lets us communicate changes such as rescheduled dates transparently.
about_feature_easy_desc: Intuitive search and a responsive seating plan get you to fixed seats in just a few clicks. Wishlist, filters by city/date/genre and clear information help you decide quickly – without detours.
about_feature_fair_desc: Prices, fees and availability are shown clearly before purchase – no hidden surprises at checkout. You can see early which options exist and what your ticket will cost in the end.
about_feature_secure_desc: Payments are handled via PCI-compliant providers; 3-D Secure is supported where available. Your data is processed according to current standards so you can book with peace of mind.
about_banner_seating_desc: Precise seating plans & clear sight lines, so you know what you’re getting.
about_channel_web_desc: Fast, low-barrier, optimised for desktop & mobile.
about_channel_hotline_desc: Empathetic advice on selection, payment & delivery.
about_channel_app_desc: Favourites, push notifications for presales, tickets always with you.
about_channel_pos_desc: Selected shops & partner outlets for in-person purchase.
about_accessibility_body:
We build OnTicket so that everyone can join. Accessibility is not an add-on for us, but a core principle. That’s why we focus on clear contrasts, intuitive navigation and clean code that works with screen readers.
Many events have specific requirements: companion seats for wheelchair users, information on sight lines, age ratings or acoustic support in the venue. Where this information is available, we show it directly in the booking process – so no questions remain unanswered.
We follow international standards (WCAG, WAI-ARIA) and regularly review our platform using user feedback to see how we can further improve it. Because real accessibility means: a fair, smooth experience for everyone – from the first click to the concert hall.
about_sustainability_desc: A primarily online ticketing platform that uses mobile tickets as standard and promotes digital processes to help reduce CO₂ emissions.
about_sustainability_img_alt: Shimmering lights in a dark room
about_team_body:
We love live culture – and that’s exactly what unites our team. Different backgrounds, expertise and personalities bring diversity to our work, but we share one thing: enthusiasm for moments you can’t stream.
In our culture, openness, speed and mutual respect are what count. We work across disciplines, try new things and constantly learn. We see mistakes as an opportunity to improve products and processes.
We celebrate not just big releases, but also the small details: a smart filter, a clean seating plan or a solved support ticket. Because in the end it’s always about people looking forward to a special experience – and we make sure the way there is enjoyable.
about_partner_body: Organiser? Venue? Agency? Let’s work together – with flexible tools, strong reach and clear reporting.
about_press_body: Enquiries to office@onticket.at. Media kit on request.
calc_nw_mode_help: ‘Fees are added on top’: revenue = base price, customers pay base + fees. ‘Price includes fees’: price is fixed, fees are deducted from your revenue.
calc_nw_tip: Tip: You can type the price or move the slider.
calc_nw_disclaimer: Illustrative fees. Actual terms may vary depending on event/partner.
calc_nw_fee_structure_value: Fixed system fee + advance booking fee
contact_intro: We’re here for you – by email, phone or on site.
contact_partners_blurb: Write to us – we’ll get back to you promptly.
help_faq_intro: Quick answers on purchase, payment, delivery, account & events.
help_faq_no_results: No results. Try another keyword or choose ‘All’.
help_faq_contact_title: Didn’t find what you were looking for?
help_faq_item_payment_methods_a: Credit/debit card, Sofort, Apple Pay/Google Pay and, depending on the event, further options. Payments are PCI-compliant, with 3-D Secure where available.
help_faq_item_refund_process_a: If an event is cancelled, we inform you automatically by email. If it is rescheduled, tickets usually remain valid; refunds are possible according to the organiser’s rules.
help_faq_item_delivery_methods_a: Mobile ticket (QR code), print-at-home and – if offered – postal delivery. Options are visible at checkout.
help_faq_item_login_help_a: Use ‘Reset password’ and check your spam folder. If your account is locked, email office@onticket.at with the subject ‘Login help’.
help_faq_item_accessible_seats_q: Are there accessible seats & companion tickets?
help_faq_item_accessible_seats_a: If available, you’ll see companion seats/sight lines in the seating plan or event notes. Our support team will be happy to help.
help_faq_item_invoice_a: Yes. After purchase you’ll find a PDF invoice in your account. For companies, enter your company details at checkout.
help_faq_item_fees_a: We show prices & fees transparently before purchase (system and presale fees depending on the event). The final amount is clearly displayed.
help_faq_item_ticket_when_q: When will I receive my ticket?
help_faq_item_ticket_when_a: Digital tickets are available immediately in your account. For postal delivery, you’ll receive tracking info by email as soon as they are sent.
ticket_delivery_intro: OnTicket offers flexible delivery options. At checkout, choose whether your ticket should be delivered as a QR code in the dashboard, as a downloadable PDF or (soon) as a classic paper ticket by post.
ticket_delivery_available_options_body: All digital tickets are stored in your OnTicket account and can be accessed again at any time.
ticket_delivery_qr_description: Your ticket is shown in the OnTicket dashboard immediately after purchase. Just have it scanned at the entrance.
ticket_delivery_pdf_description: You receive your ticket as a PDF. Save it, print it out or use it digitally.
ticket_delivery_pdf_detail_2: QR code is included in the PDF
ticket_delivery_paper_store_description: Some organisers offer classic paper tickets. Payment is made in cash at participating partner shops.
ticket_delivery_paper_store_detail_3: Perfect for customers without online payment methods
ticket_delivery_post_description: Classic postal delivery straight to your home. This option will be available soon.
ticket_delivery_post_detail_2: Delivery within a few business days
ticket_delivery_tech_body: After a successful purchase, this option is activated in the dashboard (e.g. QR code display or PDF download link).
ticket_delivery_soon_body: This option is currently not bookable and will be shown later as an additional delivery method at checkout.
ticket_delivery_step_1_body: At checkout, choose whether you want to receive your ticket as a QR code, PDF or (soon) by post.
ticket_delivery_step_2_body: Complete your purchase as usual using your preferred payment method.
ticket_delivery_step_3_body: Depending on the delivery method selected, you’ll receive your ticket in the dashboard, as a PDF or (soon) by post.
pp_item_1_a: Our website is operated by an external hosting provider. When you access our website, the hosting provider processes IP addresses, device information, browser data and server log files in order to ensure stable and secure operation. Processing takes place pursuant to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR (legitimate interest in secure website operation). A data processing agreement pursuant to Art. 28 GDPR has been concluded with the hosting provider.
pp_item_2_a: We work with external processors for hosting, payment processing, email dispatch, newsletter systems and technical support. Data processing agreements pursuant to Art. 28 GDPR have been concluded with all processors to ensure lawful and secure processing of your personal data.
pp_item_3_a: For payment processing, we transfer data to external payment service providers. These include credit card companies, banks or payment platforms. Processed data includes payment data, transaction identifiers and billing information. Processing takes place pursuant to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR (performance of contract). The respective payment service providers act as independent controllers.
pp_item_4_a: For the delivery of tickets and order confirmations, we use external service providers such as email services, SMS providers or postal services. Processing takes place pursuant to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR. Only the data necessary for delivery is transmitted.
pp_item_5_a: Each time our website is accessed, technical data is automatically collected in the form of server log files. This includes IP address, date and time of access, browser type, operating system, referrer URL and device information. Processing takes place on the basis of our legitimate interest pursuant to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR (system security and abuse prevention).
pp_item_6_a: We use only technically necessary cookies that are required for the operation of our website and the shopping cart. These cookies do not store personal data and usually expire automatically after the session. The legal basis is § 165 para. 3 TKG 2021 and Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. We do not use analytics, tracking or marketing cookies.
pp_item_7_a: If you contact us by email or via a form, we process the data you provide (name, email, phone number, content of enquiry) in order to process your request. Processing takes place pursuant to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR for contract-related enquiries and pursuant to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR for general enquiries.
pp_item_8_a: We receive personal data primarily directly from you. In some cases, we also receive data from organisers, payment service providers or business partners where this is necessary for contract processing or to fulfil legal obligations.
pp_item_9_a: We do not use automated decision-making or profiling in the sense of Art. 22 GDPR.
pp_item_10_a: Our services are not directed at children under 16 years of age. We do not knowingly process personal data of minors without the consent of their legal guardians. If we become aware of such processing, we will delete the data immediately.
pp_item_11_a:
You have the following rights under the GDPR:
- Access (Art. 15)
- Rectification (Art. 16)
- Erasure (Art. 17)
- Restriction of processing (Art. 18)
- Data portability (Art. 20)
- Objection (Art. 21)
- Withdrawal of consent (Art. 7 para. 3)
Please send your request to: privacy@onticket.at
You can lodge complaints with the data protection authority: Barichgasse 40–42, 1030 Vienna | dsb@dsb.gv.at | https://www.dsb.gv.at
pp_item_12_a: We reserve the right to update this privacy policy where necessary to reflect legal changes or adjustments to our services. The current version can be found on this website. Status: 01.01.2025.
ua_item_1_a: These Terms of Use govern the general use of our website, ticket services, customer accounts and all related functions. By accessing and using our platform, you accept the provisions of this agreement. With regard to ticket purchases, our General Terms and Conditions (GTC) also apply and take precedence.
ua_item_2_a: You can create a customer account for certain functions. You are responsible for keeping your login details safe and must inform OnTicket immediately of any suspected unauthorised access. We reserve the right to restrict or block access to the website or customer account at any time in justified cases (e.g. suspicion of misuse).
ua_item_3_a: Information about events, prices and availability may change at any time. Although we strive for accuracy, the content of our website is for information only and does not constitute a binding commitment. The only binding information is that contained in the order confirmation and the GTC.
ua_item_4_a: You undertake not to misuse our website and services. This includes in particular manipulating systems, copying content, using automated tools (bots) to retrieve data or buy tickets, disrupting operations or violating applicable law.
ua_item_5_a: All content on our website and platform, including text, graphics, logos, photos, videos and software, is protected by copyright and is the property of OnTicket GmbH or the respective licensors. Any unauthorised use, reproduction or distribution is prohibited.
ua_item_6_a: Our website may contain links to external third-party websites. OnTicket assumes no liability for the content or data protection practices of these external websites.
ua_item_7_a: We are liable for damage arising from the use of our website only in cases of intent or gross negligence. This applies in particular to data loss or system failures. For damage in connection with ticket purchases or events, the liability provisions of our General Terms and Conditions (GTC) apply exclusively.
ua_item_8_a: We may update these Terms of Use as needed to adapt to technical or legal changes. The current version published on this website always applies. Status: 01.01.2025.
rr_item_1_a: Pursuant to § 18 para. 1 no. 10 FAGG, there is no right of withdrawal when purchasing tickets for leisure events, as the service is provided at a specific date. All ticket purchases are therefore binding.
rr_item_2_a: Tickets are generally excluded from refunds. OnTicket is not the organiser, but acts solely as an intermediary. The organiser alone decides on refunds, changes or cancellations.
rr_item_3_a: If an event is officially cancelled, there is a claim for a refund of the ticket price against the organiser. OnTicket handles the refund of the ticket price if the organiser instructs OnTicket to do so and provides the necessary funds. Service or shipping charges already provided are not refunded.
rr_item_4_a: If an event is postponed, the ticket remains valid for the new date. A refund is only possible if the organiser expressly allows it. OnTicket has no influence on this decision.
rr_item_5_a: Reasonable changes, such as minor timetable or line-up changes, do not entitle the customer to return tickets. Only significant changes with the organiser’s consent may allow refunds.
rr_item_6_a: Instead of a refund, the organiser may offer a voucher. OnTicket can issue such vouchers only on behalf of the organiser. The organiser determines the conditions and validity.
rr_item_7_a: Approved refunds are made using the original payment method. Processing time depends on the payment provider. Without the organiser’s instruction and provision of funds, OnTicket cannot process refunds.
rr_item_8_a: Lost or stolen tickets are not refunded. Re-issuing tickets is only possible with the organiser’s consent. Misused or duplicated tickets are excluded from refunds.
rr_item_9_a: The customer is responsible for providing correct contact details. Refund claims based on incorrect email addresses, spam filters or unread notifications cannot be accepted.
rr_item_10_a: For refund enquiries, please contact OnTicket at: office@onticket.at. Processing is only possible if the organiser has given a clear refund instruction.
contact_form_helper: Briefly describe your issue – we’ll get back to you as soon as possible.
contact_sidepanel_intro: Our support team helps with questions about tickets, payments and your account.
contact_sidepanel_point1: We usually reply within 1–2 business days.
contact_sidepanel_point2: If possible, please include your order number.
contact_sidepanel_point3: For urgent cases, call us directly.
calc_nw_page_how_p1: The calculator shows you how the ticket price and fees are structured. You can define whether fees are added on top or already included in the price.
calc_nw_page_how_p2: The display updates automatically and shows you the final price for customers, the individual fees and your payout amount.
calc_nw_page_notes_p1: The calculation is for guidance only. All values are based on the entered data and current fee models.
calc_nw_page_notes_p2: The actual payout may differ depending on further settings or individual agreements.
calc_nw_page_contact_intro: Do you have questions, want to discuss your results or need an individual assessment?
